title: WCAS ART_HIST 390-0-2 Undergraduate Seminar
topic: Art & Photography in the Black Power Era

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: The 1960s and 1970s saw many social and political shifts in black communities in the United States and globally as diverse calls for "black power" resounded. The course explores how movements surrounding black power informed art, photography, and visual culture. How did the demands of black power inspire, hamper, and/or transform artistic practice and mainstream art museums? What aesthetic forms, art collectives, exhibitions, and institutions came into formation in the black power era and toward what ends? What were some of the limits, including regarding gender and sexuality, of these movements? How do some of the debates of the era?surrounding, for example, art and social change, abstraction and figuration, and the local politics of race and internationalism?continue to inform artistic practice?
